A high performance focused game engine using object oriented techniques based in the latest C++

43//
44// Date: May 11, 2022
45// File: nvapi.h
46//
47// NvAPI provides an interface to NVIDIA devices. This file contains the
48// interface constants, structure definitions and function prototypes.
49//
50// Target Profile: developer
51// Target Platform: windows
52//
54#ifndef _NVAPI_H
55#define _NVAPI_H
56
57#pragma pack(push,8) // Make sure we have consistent structure packings
58
59#ifdef __cplusplus
60extern "C" {
61#endif
62// ====================================================
63// Universal NvAPI Definitions
64// ====================================================
65#ifndef _WIN32
66#define __cdecl
67#endif
68
69
70
72
73
75#define NVAPI_API_NOT_INTIALIZED NVAPI_API_NOT_INITIALIZED
76
78//
79// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Initialize
80//
97NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Initialize();
98
99
101//
102// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Unload
103//
127NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Unload();
128
130//
131// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_GetErrorMessage
132//
146NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_GetErrorMessage(NvAPI_Status nr,NvAPI_ShortString szDesc);
147
149//
150// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_GetInterfaceVersionString
151//
167NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_GetInterfaceVersionString(NvAPI_ShortString szDesc);
168
170//
171// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_GetInterfaceVersionStringEx
172//
187NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_GetInterfaceVersionStringEx(NvAPI_ShortString szDesc);

191// All display port related data types definition starts
193
194// This category is intentionally added before the #ifdef. The #endif should also be in the same scope
195
196#ifndef DISPLAYPORT_STRUCTS_DEFINED
197#define DISPLAYPORT_STRUCTS_DEFINED
198
201typedef enum _NV_DP_LINK_RATE
202{
203 NV_DP_1_62GBPS = 6,
204 NV_DP_2_70GBPS = 0xA,
205 NV_DP_5_40GBPS = 0x14,
206 NV_DP_8_10GBPS = 0x1E,
207// Recommended Intermidiate Link Transfer Rates
208 NV_EDP_2_16GBPS = 8,
209 NV_EDP_2_43GBPS = 9,
210 NV_EDP_3_24GBPS = 0xC,
211 NV_EDP_4_32GBPS = 0x10
212} NV_DP_LINK_RATE;
213
214
217typedef enum _NV_DP_LANE_COUNT
218{
219 NV_DP_1_LANE = 1,
220 NV_DP_2_LANE = 2,
221 NV_DP_4_LANE = 4,
222} NV_DP_LANE_COUNT;
223
224
227typedef enum _NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT
228{
229 NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT_RGB = 0,
230 NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT_YCbCr422,
231 NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT_YCbCr444,
232} NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT;
233
234
237typedef enum _NV_DP_COLORIMETRY
238{
239 NV_DP_COLORIMETRY_RGB = 0,
240 NV_DP_COLORIMETRY_YCbCr_ITU601,
241 NV_DP_COLORIMETRY_YCbCr_ITU709,
242} NV_DP_COLORIMETRY;
243
244
247typedef enum _NV_DP_DYNAMIC_RANGE
248{
249 NV_DP_DYNAMIC_RANGE_VESA = 0,
250 NV_DP_DYNAMIC_RANGE_CEA,
251} NV_DP_DYNAMIC_RANGE;
252
253
256typedef enum _NV_DP_BPC
257{
258 NV_DP_BPC_DEFAULT = 0,
259 NV_DP_BPC_6,
260 NV_DP_BPC_8,
261 NV_DP_BPC_10,
262 NV_DP_BPC_12,
263 NV_DP_BPC_16,
264} NV_DP_BPC;
265

267#endif //#ifndef DISPLAYPORT_STRUCTS_DEFINED

274//
275// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_GPU_GetEDID
276//
291//
293
296
297#define NV_EDID_V1_DATA_SIZE 256
298
299#define NV_EDID_DATA_SIZE NV_EDID_V1_DATA_SIZE
300
301typedef struct
302{
303 NvU32 version; //structure version
304 NvU8 EDID_Data[NV_EDID_DATA_SIZE];
305} NV_EDID_V1;
306
308typedef struct
309{
310 NvU32 version;
311 NvU8 EDID_Data[NV_EDID_DATA_SIZE];
312 NvU32 sizeofEDID;
313} NV_EDID_V2;
314
316typedef struct
317{
318 NvU32 version;
319 NvU8 EDID_Data[NV_EDID_DATA_SIZE];
320 NvU32 sizeofEDID;
321 NvU32 edidId;
324 NvU32 offset;
327} NV_EDID_V3;
328
329typedef NV_EDID_V3 NV_EDID;
330
331#define NV_EDID_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_EDID_V1,1)
332#define NV_EDID_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_EDID_V2,2)
333#define NV_EDID_VER3 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_EDID_V3,3)
334#define NV_EDID_VER NV_EDID_VER3
335
337
339NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_GPU_GetEDID(NvPhysicalGpuHandle hPhysicalGpu, NvU32 displayOutputId, NV_EDID *pEDID);
340
343typedef enum _NV_GPU_CONNECTOR_TYPE
344{
345 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_VGA_15_PIN = 0x00000000,
346 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_COMPOSITE = 0x00000010,
347 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_SVIDEO = 0x00000011,
348 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_HDTV_COMPONENT = 0x00000013,
349 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_SCART = 0x00000014,
350 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_COMPOSITE_SCART_ON_EIAJ4120 = 0x00000016,
351 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_TV_HDTV_EIAJ4120 = 0x00000017,
352 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_PC_POD_HDTV_YPRPB = 0x00000018,
353 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_PC_POD_SVIDEO = 0x00000019,
354 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_PC_POD_COMPOSITE = 0x0000001A,
355 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DVI_I_TV_SVIDEO = 0x00000020,
356 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DVI_I_TV_COMPOSITE = 0x00000021,
357 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DVI_I = 0x00000030,
358 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DVI_D = 0x00000031,
359 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_ADC = 0x00000032,
360 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_LFH_DVI_I_1 = 0x00000038,
361 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_LFH_DVI_I_2 = 0x00000039,
362 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_SPWG = 0x00000040,
363 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_OEM = 0x00000041,
364 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DISPLAYPORT_EXTERNAL = 0x00000046,
365 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DISPLAYPORT_INTERNAL = 0x00000047,
366 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_DISPLAYPORT_MINI_EXT = 0x00000048,
367 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_HDMI_A = 0x00000061,
368 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_HDMI_C_MINI = 0x00000063,
369 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_LFH_DISPLAYPORT_1 = 0x00000064,
370 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_LFH_DISPLAYPORT_2 = 0x00000065,
371 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_VIRTUAL_WFD = 0x00000070,
372 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_USB_C = 0x00000071,
373 NVAPI_GPU_CONNECTOR_UNKNOWN = 0xFFFFFFFF,
374} NV_GPU_CONNECTOR_TYPE;

384typedef enum _NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT
385{
386 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_NONE = 0,
387 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_NTSCM = 0x00000001,
388 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_NTSCJ = 0x00000002,
389 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_PALM = 0x00000004,
390 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_PALBDGH = 0x00000008,
391 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_PALN = 0x00000010,
392 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_PALNC = 0x00000020,
393 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_576i = 0x00000100,
394 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_480i = 0x00000200,
395 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_ED_480p = 0x00000400,
396 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_ED_576p = 0x00000800,
397 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_720p = 0x00001000,
398 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_1080i = 0x00002000,
399 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_1080p = 0x00004000,
400 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_720p50 = 0x00008000,
401 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_1080p24 = 0x00010000,
402 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_1080i50 = 0x00020000,
403 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_1080p50 = 0x00040000,
404 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp30 = 0x00080000,
405 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp30_3840 = NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp30,
406 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp25 = 0x00100000,
407 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp25_3840 = NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp25,
408 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24 = 0x00200000,
409 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24_3840 = NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24,
410 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24_SMPTE = 0x00400000,
411 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp50_3840 = 0x00800000,
412 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp60_3840 = 0x00900000,
413 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp30_4096 = 0x00A00000,
414 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp25_4096 = 0x00B00000,
415 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24_4096 = 0x00C00000,
416 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp50_4096 = 0x00D00000,
417 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp60_4096 = 0x00E00000,
418 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp24_7680 = 0x01000000,
419 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp25_7680 = 0x02000000,
420 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp30_7680 = 0x04000000,
421 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp48_7680 = 0x08000000,
422 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp50_7680 = 0x09000000,
423 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp60_7680 = 0x0A000000,
424 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp100_7680 = 0x0B000000,
425 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_8Kp120_7680 = 0x0C000000,
426 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp48_3840 = 0x0D000000,
427 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp48_4096 = 0x0E000000,
428 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp100_4096 = 0x0F000000,
429 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp100_3840 = 0x10000000,
430 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp120_4096 = 0x11000000,
431 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp120_3840 = 0x12000000,
432 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp100_5120 = 0x13000000,
433 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp120_5120 = 0x14000000,
434 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp24_5120 = 0x15000000,
435 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp25_5120 = 0x16000000,
436 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp30_5120 = 0x17000000,
437 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp48_5120 = 0x18000000,
438 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp50_5120 = 0x19000000,
439 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_4Kp60_5120 = 0x20000000,
440 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp24_10240 = 0x21000000,
441 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp25_10240 = 0x22000000,
442 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp30_10240 = 0x23000000,
443 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp48_10240 = 0x24000000,
444 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp50_10240 = 0x25000000,
445 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp60_10240 = 0x26000000,
446 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp100_10240 = 0x27000000,
447 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_UHD_10Kp120_10240 = 0x28000000,
448
449
450 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_SD_OTHER = 0x30000000,
451 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_ED_OTHER = 0x40000000,
452 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_HD_OTHER = 0x50000000,
453
454 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT_ANY = 0x80000000,
455
456} NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT;

469{

482
485typedef enum _NV_SCALING
486{
487 NV_SCALING_DEFAULT = 0,
488
489 // New Scaling Declarations
490 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_CLOSEST = 1,
491 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_NATIVE = 2,
492 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCANOUT_TO_NATIVE = 3,
493 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_ASPECT_SCANOUT_TO_NATIVE = 5,
494 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_ASPECT_SCANOUT_TO_CLOSEST = 6,
495 NV_SCALING_GPU_SCANOUT_TO_CLOSEST = 7,
496 NV_SCALING_GPU_INTEGER_ASPECT_SCALING = 8,
497
498 // Legacy Declarations
499 NV_SCALING_MONITOR_SCALING = NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_CLOSEST,
500 NV_SCALING_ADAPTER_SCALING = NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_NATIVE,
501 NV_SCALING_CENTERED = NV_SCALING_GPU_SCANOUT_TO_NATIVE,
502 NV_SCALING_ASPECT_SCALING = NV_SCALING_GPU_SCALING_TO_ASPECT_SCANOUT_TO_NATIVE,
503
504 NV_SCALING_CUSTOMIZED = 255
505} NV_SCALING;
506
508
510typedef enum _NV_ROTATE
511{
512 NV_ROTATE_0 = 0,
513 NV_ROTATE_90 = 1,
514 NV_ROTATE_180 = 2,
515 NV_ROTATE_270 = 3,
516 NV_ROTATE_IGNORED = 4,
517} NV_ROTATE;
518
521#define NVFORMAT_MAKEFOURCC(ch0, ch1, ch2, ch3) \
522 ((NvU32)(NvU8)(ch0) | ((NvU32)(NvU8)(ch1) << 8) | \
523 ((NvU32)(NvU8)(ch2) << 16) | ((NvU32)(NvU8)(ch3) << 24 ))
524
525
526

530{
531 NV_FORMAT_UNKNOWN = 0,
532 NV_FORMAT_P8 = 41,
533 NV_FORMAT_R5G6B5 = 23,
534 NV_FORMAT_A8R8G8B8 = 21,
535 NV_FORMAT_A16B16G16R16F = 113,
536
537} NV_FORMAT;

577#ifndef NV_TIMING_STRUCTS_DEFINED
578#define NV_TIMING_STRUCTS_DEFINED
579
580//***********************
581// The Timing Structure
582//***********************
583//
587typedef struct tagNV_TIMINGEXT
588{
589 NvU32 flag;
590 NvU16 rr;
591 NvU32 rrx1k;
592 NvU32 aspect;
593 NvU16 rep;
594 NvU32 status;
595 NvU8 name[40];
596}NV_TIMINGEXT;
597
598
599
627typedef struct _NV_TIMING
628{
629 // VESA scan out timing parameters:
630 NvU16 HVisible;
631 NvU16 HBorder;
632 NvU16 HFrontPorch;
633 NvU16 HSyncWidth;
634 NvU16 HTotal;
635 NvU8 HSyncPol;
636
637 NvU16 VVisible;
638 NvU16 VBorder;
639 NvU16 VFrontPorch;
640 NvU16 VSyncWidth;
641 NvU16 VTotal;
642 NvU8 VSyncPol;
643
644 NvU16 interlaced;
645 NvU32 pclk;
646
647 //other timing related extras
648 NV_TIMINGEXT etc;
649}NV_TIMING;
650#endif //NV_TIMING_STRUCTS_DEFINED
651
652
656#define NV_TIMING_H_SYNC_POSITIVE 0
657#define NV_TIMING_H_SYNC_NEGATIVE 1
658#define NV_TIMING_H_SYNC_DEFAULT NV_TIMING_H_SYNC_NEGATIVE
659//
660#define NV_TIMING_V_SYNC_POSITIVE 0
661#define NV_TIMING_V_SYNC_NEGATIVE 1
662#define NV_TIMING_V_SYNC_DEFAULT NV_TIMING_V_SYNC_POSITIVE
663//
664#define NV_TIMING_PROGRESSIVE 0
665#define NV_TIMING_INTERLACED 1
666#define NV_TIMING_INTERLACED_EXTRA_VBLANK_ON_FIELD2 1
667#define NV_TIMING_INTERLACED_NO_EXTRA_VBLANK_ON_FIELD2 2
669
671//
672// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_SetView
673//
696//
698
701typedef struct
702{
703 NvU32 version;
704 NvU32 count;
705 struct
706 {
707 NvU32 deviceMask;
708 NvU32 sourceId;
709 NvU32 bPrimary:1;
711 NvU32 bInterlaced:1;
712 NvU32 bGDIPrimary:1;
713 NvU32 bForceModeSet:1;
714 } target[NVAPI_MAX_VIEW_TARGET];
715} NV_VIEW_TARGET_INFO;
716
718#define NV_VIEW_TARGET_INFO_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_VIEW_TARGET_INFO,2)
719
720
722__nvapi_deprecated_function("Do not use this function - it is deprecated in release 290. Instead, use NvAPI_DISP_SetDisplayConfig.")
723NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_SetView(NvDisplayHandle hNvDisplay, NV_VIEW_TARGET_INFO *pTargetInfo, NV_TARGET_VIEW_MODE targetView);
724
725
727//
728// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_SetViewEx
729//
753//
755
757#define NVAPI_MAX_DISPLAY_PATH NVAPI_MAX_VIEW_TARGET
758
760#define NVAPI_ADVANCED_MAX_DISPLAY_PATH NVAPI_ADVANCED_MAX_VIEW_TARGET
761
762
763
766typedef struct
767{
768 NvU32 deviceMask;
769 NvU32 sourceId;
770 NvU32 bPrimary:1;
772 NV_GPU_CONNECTOR_TYPE connector;
773
774 // source mode information
775 NvU32 width;
776 NvU32 height;
777 NvU32 depth;
778 NV_FORMAT colorFormat;
779
780 //rotation setting of the mode
781 NV_ROTATE rotation;
782
783 // the scaling mode
784 NV_SCALING scaling;
785
786 // Timing info
787 NvU32 refreshRate;
788 NvU32 interlaced:1;
789
790 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT tvFormat;
791
792 // Windows desktop position
793 NvU32 posx;
794 NvU32 posy;
795 NvU32 bGDIPrimary:1;
796
797 NvU32 bForceModeSet:1;
798 NvU32 bFocusDisplay:1;
799 NvU32 gpuId:24;
800
801} NV_DISPLAY_PATH;
802
805typedef struct
806{
807 NvU32 version;
808 NvU32 count;
809 NV_DISPLAY_PATH path[NVAPI_MAX_DISPLAY_PATH];
810} NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_V3;
811
814typedef struct
815{
816 NvU32 version;
817 NvU32 count;
818 NV_DISPLAY_PATH path[NVAPI_ADVANCED_MAX_DISPLAY_PATH];
819} NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO;
820
824#define NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER4
825#define NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER4 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO,4)
826#define NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER3 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO,3)
827#define NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO,2)
828#define NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO,1)
831//
832// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_SetViewEx
833//
857//
859
861__nvapi_deprecated_function("Do not use this function - it is deprecated in release 290. Instead, use NvAPI_DISP_SetDisplayConfig.")
862NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_SetViewEx(NvDisplayHandle hNvDisplay, NV_DISPLAY_PATH_INFO *pPathInfo, NV_TARGET_VIEW_MODE displayView);
863
864
865
867// SetDisplayConfig/GetDisplayConfig
870
871typedef struct _NV_POSITION
872{
873 NvS32 x;
874 NvS32 y;
875} NV_POSITION;
876
878typedef struct _NV_RESOLUTION
879{
880 NvU32 width;
881 NvU32 height;
882 NvU32 colorDepth;
883} NV_RESOLUTION;
884
886typedef struct _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_V1
887{
888 NvU32 version;
889
890 // Rotation and Scaling
891 NV_ROTATE rotation;
892 NV_SCALING scaling;
893
894 // Refresh Rate
895 NvU32 refreshRate1K;
897 // Flags
898 NvU32 interlaced:1;
899 NvU32 primary:1;
902#ifdef NV_PAN_AND_SCAN_DEFINED
903 NvU32 isPanAndScanTarget:1;
905#else
906 NvU32 reservedBit1:1;
907#endif
908 NvU32 disableVirtualModeSupport:1;
909 NvU32 isPreferredUnscaledTarget:1;
910 NvU32 reserved:27;
911 // TV format information
912 NV_GPU_CONNECTOR_TYPE connector;
913 NV_DISPLAY_TV_FORMAT tvFormat;
918
919 // Backend (raster) timing standard
920 NV_TIMING_OVERRIDE timingOverride;
921 NV_TIMING timing;
924} NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_V1;
925
927typedef NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_V1 NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO;
928
930#define NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_V1,1)
931
933#define NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_VER NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO_VER1
934
936typedef struct _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO_V1
937{
938 NvU32 displayId;
939 NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO* details;
940} NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO_V1;
941
943typedef struct _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO_V2
944{
945 NvU32 displayId;
946 NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_ADVANCED_TARGET_INFO* details;
947 NvU32 targetId;
948} NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO_V2;

994#define _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_INFO_V2 _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_INFO

997typedef struct _NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_INFO_V2
998{

1001 NvU32 sourceId;
1002 NvU32 reserved_sourceId;
1003 };
1004
1005 NvU32 targetInfoCount;
1006 NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_TARGET_INFO_V2* targetInfo;
1007 NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_SOURCE_MODE_INFO_V1* sourceModeInfo;
1008 NvU32 IsNonNVIDIAAdapter : 1;
1009 NvU32 reserved : 31;
1010 void *pOSAdapterID;
1012} NV_DISPLAYCONFIG_PATH_INFO_V2;
1013

1118{

1123 NVAPI_GPU_PERF_PSTATE20_CLOCK_TYPE_RANGE,

1127typedef struct
1128{
1130 NvS32 value;
1131
1132 struct
1133 {
1135 NvS32 min;
1136
1138 NvS32 max;
1139 } valueRange;
1140} NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES20_PARAM_DELTA;
1141
1143typedef struct
1144{
1146 NV_GPU_PUBLIC_CLOCK_ID domainId;
1147
1149 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATE20_CLOCK_TYPE_ID typeId;
1150 NvU32 bIsEditable:1;
1151
1153 NvU32 reserved:31;
1154
1156 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES20_PARAM_DELTA freqDelta_kHz;
1157
1159 union
1160 {
1161 struct
1162 {
1164 NvU32 freq_kHz;
1165 } single;
1166
1167 struct
1168 {
1170 NvU32 minFreq_kHz;
1171
1173 NvU32 maxFreq_kHz;
1174
1176 NV_GPU_PERF_VOLTAGE_INFO_DOMAIN_ID domainId;
1177 NvU32 minVoltage_uV;
1178 NvU32 maxVoltage_uV;
1179 } range;
1180 } data;
1181} NV_GPU_PSTATE20_CLOCK_ENTRY_V1;
1182
1184typedef struct
1185{
1187 NV_GPU_PERF_VOLTAGE_INFO_DOMAIN_ID domainId;
1188 NvU32 bIsEditable:1;
1189
1191 NvU32 reserved:31;
1192
1194 NvU32 volt_uV;
1195
1196 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES20_PARAM_DELTA voltDelta_uV; // Current base voltage delta from nominal settings in [uV]
1197} NV_GPU_PSTATE20_BASE_VOLTAGE_ENTRY_V1;
1198
1200
1201typedef struct
1202{
1204 NvU32 version;
1205
1206 NvU32 bIsEditable:1;
1207
1209 NvU32 reserved:31;
1210
1212 NvU32 numPstates;
1213

1223 {

1234 NV_GPU_PSTATE20_CLOCK_ENTRY_V1 clocks[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PSTATE20_CLOCKS];

1238 NV_GPU_PSTATE20_BASE_VOLTAGE_ENTRY_V1 baseVoltages[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PSTATE20_BASE_VOLTAGES];

1287 {

1414#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_NONE 0x00000000
1415#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_ERROR 0x00000001
1416#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_SWFALLBACK 0x00000002
1417#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_BASIC_INFO 0x00000004
1418#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_DETAILED_INFO 0x00000008
1419#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_PERFORMANCE_WARNING 0x00000010
1420#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_QUALITY_WARNING 0x00000020
1421#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_USAGE_WARNING 0x00000040
1422#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_DETAIL_ALL 0xFFFFFFFF
1423
1424#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_NONE 0x00000000
1425#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_ERROR 0x00000001
1426#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_SWFALLBACK 0x00000002
1427#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_VERTEX 0x00000004
1428#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_GEOMETRY 0x00000008
1429#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_XFB 0x00000010
1430#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_RASTER 0x00000020
1431#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_FRAGMENT 0x00000040
1432#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_ROP 0x00000080
1433#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_FRAMEBUFFER 0x00000100
1434#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_PIXEL 0x00000200
1435#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_PIPELINE_TEXTURE 0x00000400
1436#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_OBJECT_BUFFEROBJECT 0x00000800
1437#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_OBJECT_TEXTURE 0x00001000
1438#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_OBJECT_PROGRAM 0x00002000
1439#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_OBJECT_FBO 0x00004000
1440#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_FEATURE_SLI 0x00008000
1441#define NVAPI_OGLEXPERT_REPORT_ALL 0xFFFFFFFF

1906typedef struct _NV_GPU_DISPLAYIDS
1907{
1908 NvU32 version;
1909 NV_MONITOR_CONN_TYPE connectorType;
1911 NvU32 displayId;
1912
1913 NvU32 isDynamic : 1;
1914 NvU32 isMultiStreamRootNode : 1;
1917 NvU32 isActive : 1;
1918 NvU32 isCluster : 1;
1919 NvU32 isOSVisible : 1;
1920 NvU32 isWFD : 1;
1921 NvU32 isConnected : 1;
1922
1923 NvU32 reservedInternal : 10;
1924 NvU32 isPhysicallyConnected : 1;
1925 NvU32 reserved : 14;
1926} NV_GPU_DISPLAYIDS;

2801 {

2809 };

2814 };

2849
2850
2852// I2C API
2853// Provides ability to read or write data using I2C protocol.
2854// These APIs allow I2C access only to DDC monitors
2855
2856
2859#define NVAPI_MAX_SIZEOF_I2C_DATA_BUFFER 4096
2860#define NVAPI_MAX_SIZEOF_I2C_REG_ADDRESS 4
2861#define NVAPI_DISPLAY_DEVICE_MASK_MAX 24
2862#define NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_DEPRECATED 0xFFFF
2863
2864typedef enum
2865{
2866 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_DEFAULT,
2867 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_3KHZ,
2868 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_10KHZ,
2869 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_33KHZ,
2870 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_100KHZ,
2871 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_200KHZ,
2872 NVAPI_I2C_SPEED_400KHZ,
2873} NV_I2C_SPEED;
2874
2876typedef struct
2877{
2878 NvU32 version;
2879 NvU32 displayMask;
2880 NvU8 bIsDDCPort;
2882 NvU8 i2cDevAddress;
2886 NvU8* pbI2cRegAddress;
2888 NvU32 regAddrSize;
2890 NvU8* pbData;
2891 NvU32 cbSize;
2892 NvU32 i2cSpeed;
2893} NV_I2C_INFO_V1;
2894
2896typedef struct
2897{
2898 NvU32 version;
2899 NvU32 displayMask;
2900 NvU8 bIsDDCPort;
2902 NvU8 i2cDevAddress;
2906 NvU8* pbI2cRegAddress;
2908 NvU32 regAddrSize;
2910 NvU8* pbData;
2911 NvU32 cbSize;
2912 NvU32 i2cSpeed;
2913 NV_I2C_SPEED i2cSpeedKhz;
2914} NV_I2C_INFO_V2;
2915
2917typedef struct
2918{
2919 NvU32 version;
2920 NvU32 displayMask;
2921 NvU8 bIsDDCPort;
2923 NvU8 i2cDevAddress;
2927 NvU8* pbI2cRegAddress;
2929 NvU32 regAddrSize;
2931 NvU8* pbData;
2932 NvU32 cbSize;
2933 NvU32 i2cSpeed;
2934 NV_I2C_SPEED i2cSpeedKhz;
2935 NvU8 portId;
2937 NvU32 bIsPortIdSet;
2938} NV_I2C_INFO_V3;
2939
2940typedef NV_I2C_INFO_V3 NV_I2C_INFO;
2941
2942#define NV_I2C_INFO_VER3 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_I2C_INFO_V3,3)
2943#define NV_I2C_INFO_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_I2C_INFO_V2,2)
2944#define NV_I2C_INFO_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_I2C_INFO_V1,1)
2945
2946#define NV_I2C_INFO_VER NV_I2C_INFO_VER3

3122 NV_GPU_HDCP_FUSE_STATE_ENABLED = 2,

3124
3125
3127typedef enum _NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE
3128{
3129 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_UNKNOWN = 0,
3130 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_NONE = 1,
3131 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_CRYPTO_ROM = 2,
3132 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_SBIOS = 3,
3133 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_I2C_ROM = 4,
3134 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_FUSES = 5,

3137
3139typedef enum _NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_STATE
3140{
3141 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_STATE_UNKNOWN = 0,
3142 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_STATE_ABSENT = 1,
3143 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_STATE_PRESENT = 2,

3146
3148typedef struct
3149{
3150 NvU32 version;

3153 NV_GPU_HDCP_KEY_SOURCE_STATE hdcpKeySourceState;

3163
3165NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_GPU_GetHDCPSupportStatus(NvPhysicalGpuHandle hPhysicalGpu, NV_GPU_GET_HDCP_SUPPORT_STATUS *pGetHDCPSupportStatus);
3166
3167
3168
3169
3172
3175
3176#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_PHYSICS_CAPABLE NV_BIT(0)
3177#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_PHYSICS_ENABLE NV_BIT(1)
3178#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_PHYSICS_DEDICATED NV_BIT(2)
3180#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_PHYSICS_RECOMMENDED NV_BIT(3)
3181#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_CUDA_AVAILABLE NV_BIT(4)
3182#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_CUDA_CAPABLE NV_BIT(16)
3183#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_CUDA_DISABLED NV_BIT(17)
3184#define NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_PHYSICS_AVAILABLE NV_BIT(21)
3185
3187
3188typedef struct
3189{
3190 NvU32 version;
3191 NvU32 gpuCount;
3192
3193 struct
3194 {
3195 NvPhysicalGpuHandle hPhysicalGpu;
3196 NvU32 flags;
3197
3198 } computeGpus[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PER_TOPOLOGY];
3199
3200} NV_COMPUTE_GPU_TOPOLOGY_V1;

3509// The following enum is providing definitions for events signaled by a Quadro Sync (QSYNC) device.
3510// QSYNC event broadcast is supported for Windows 10 and later OS.
3511typedef enum
3512{
3513 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_NONE = 0,
3514 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_SYNC_LOSS = 1, // Frame Lock sync loss event
3515 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_SYNC_GAIN = 2, // Frame Lock sync gain event
3516 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_HOUSESYNC_GAIN = 3, // House cable gain(plug in) event
3517 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_HOUSESYNC_LOSS = 4, // House cable loss(plug out) event
3518 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_RJ45_GAIN = 5, // RJ45 cable gain(plug in) event
3519 NV_QSYNC_EVENT_RJ45_LOSS = 6, // RJ45 cable loss(plug out) event
3520} NV_QSYNC_EVENT;
3521
3522typedef struct
3523{
3524 NV_QSYNC_EVENT qsyncEvent; // One of the value of the enum NV_QSYNC_EVENT
3525 NvU32 reserved[7]; // Reserved for future use. Do not use this.
3526} NV_QSYNC_EVENT_DATA;
3527
3529typedef void(__cdecl *NVAPI_CALLBACK_QSYNCEVENT)(NV_QSYNC_EVENT_DATA qyncEventData, void *callbackParam);
3530
3531
3533typedef enum
3534{
3535 NV_EVENT_TYPE_NONE = 0,
3536 NV_EVENT_TYPE_QSYNC = 6,
3537} NV_EVENT_TYPE;
3538
3540typedef struct
3541{
3542 NvU32 version;
3543 NV_EVENT_TYPE eventId;
3544 void *callbackParam;
3545 union
3546 {
3547 NVAPI_CALLBACK_QSYNCEVENT nvQSYNCEventCallback;
3548 }nvCallBackFunc;
3549
3550} NV_EVENT_REGISTER_CALLBACK, *PNV_EVENT_REGISTER_CALLBACK;
3551
3553#define NV_EVENT_REGISTER_CALLBACK_VERSION MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_EVENT_REGISTER_CALLBACK,1)
3554

4256
4259typedef struct
4260{
4261 NvU32 version;
4262 NvU32 flags;
4266 NvU32 numPstates;
4267 NvU32 numClocks;
4268 struct
4269 {
4270 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATE_ID pstateId;
4271 NvU32 flags;
4275 struct
4276 {
4277 NV_GPU_PUBLIC_CLOCK_ID domainId;
4278 NvU32 flags;
4279 NvU32 freq;
4280
4281 } clocks[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PERF_CLOCKS];
4282 } pstates[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PERF_PSTATES];
4283
4284} NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO_V1;
4285
4286
4288typedef struct
4289{
4290 NvU32 version;
4291 NvU32 flags;
4295 NvU32 numPstates;
4296 NvU32 numClocks;
4297 NvU32 numVoltages;
4298 struct
4299 {
4300 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATE_ID pstateId;
4301 NvU32 flags;
4305 struct
4306 {
4307 NV_GPU_PUBLIC_CLOCK_ID domainId;
4308 NvU32 flags;
4310 NvU32 freq;
4311
4312 } clocks[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PERF_CLOCKS];
4313 struct
4314 {
4315 NV_GPU_PERF_VOLTAGE_INFO_DOMAIN_ID domainId;
4316 NvU32 flags;
4317 NvU32 mvolt;
4318
4319 } voltages[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PERF_VOLTAGES];
4320
4321 } pstates[NVAPI_MAX_GPU_PERF_PSTATES];
4322
4323} NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO_V2;
4324
4326typedef NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO_V2 NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO;
4327

4331

4336#define NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_GPU_PERF_PSTATES_INFO_V2,2)

4527// Thermal API
4528// Provides ability to get temperature levels from the various thermal sensors associated with the GPU
4529
4531#define NVAPI_MAX_THERMAL_SENSORS_PER_GPU 3
4532
4535typedef enum
4536{
4537 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_NONE = 0,
4538 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_GPU = 1,
4539 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_MEMORY = 2,
4540 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_POWER_SUPPLY = 4,
4541 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_BOARD = 8,
4542 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_VCD_BOARD = 9,
4543 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_VCD_INLET = 10,
4544 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_VCD_OUTLET = 11,
4545
4546 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_ALL = 15,
4547 NVAPI_THERMAL_TARGET_UNKNOWN = -1,
4548} NV_THERMAL_TARGET;
4549
4552typedef enum
4553{
4554 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_NONE = 0,
4555 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_GPU_INTERNAL,
4556 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_ADM1032,
4557 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_MAX6649,
4558 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_MAX1617,
4559 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_LM99,
4560 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_LM89,
4561 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_LM64,
4562 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_ADT7473,
4563 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_SBMAX6649,
4564 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_VBIOSEVT,
4565 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_OS,
4566 NVAPI_THERMAL_CONTROLLER_UNKNOWN = -1,
4567} NV_THERMAL_CONTROLLER;
4568
4571typedef struct
4572{
4573 NvU32 version;
4574 NvU32 count;
4575 struct
4576 {
4577 NV_THERMAL_CONTROLLER controller;
4578 NvU32 defaultMinTemp;
4579 NvU32 defaultMaxTemp;
4580 NvU32 currentTemp;
4581 NV_THERMAL_TARGET target;
4582 } sensor[NVAPI_MAX_THERMAL_SENSORS_PER_GPU];
4583
4584} NV_GPU_THERMAL_SETTINGS_V1;

4588{
4589 NvU32 version;

4592 {

4595 NvS32 defaultMaxTemp;

4598 } sensor[NVAPI_MAX_THERMAL_SENSORS_PER_GPU];

5490typedef struct _NV_GPU_CLIENT_ILLUM_ZONE_CONTROL_DATA_RGB
5491{
5496 union
5497 {
5498 //
5499 // Need to be careful when add/expanding types in this union. If any type
5500 // exceeds sizeof(rsvd) then rsvd has failed its purpose.
5501 //
5502 NV_GPU_CLIENT_ILLUM_ZONE_CONTROL_DATA_MANUAL_RGB manualRGB;
5503 NV_GPU_CLIENT_ILLUM_ZONE_CONTROL_DATA_PIECEWISE_LINEAR_RGB piecewiseLinearRGB;
5504
5508 NvU8 rsvd[64];
5509 } data;
5510
5514 NvU8 rsvd[64];
5515} NV_GPU_CLIENT_ILLUM_ZONE_CONTROL_DATA_RGB;

6157typedef struct _NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_V1
6158{
6159 NvU32 version;
6160 NvU32 dpcd_ver;
6161 NV_DP_LINK_RATE maxLinkRate;
6162 NV_DP_LANE_COUNT maxLaneCount;
6163 NV_DP_LINK_RATE curLinkRate;
6164 NV_DP_LANE_COUNT curLaneCount;
6165 NV_DP_COLOR_FORMAT colorFormat;
6166 NV_DP_DYNAMIC_RANGE dynamicRange;
6167 NV_DP_COLORIMETRY colorimetry;
6168 NV_DP_BPC bpc;
6169 NvU32 isDp : 1;
6170 NvU32 isInternalDp : 1;
6171 NvU32 isColorCtrlSupported : 1;
6172 NvU32 is6BPCSupported : 1;
6173 NvU32 is8BPCSupported : 1;
6174 NvU32 is10BPCSupported : 1;
6175 NvU32 is12BPCSupported : 1;
6176 NvU32 is16BPCSupported : 1;
6177 NvU32 isYCrCb420Supported : 1;
6178 NvU32 isYCrCb422Supported : 1;
6179 NvU32 isYCrCb444Supported : 1;
6180 NvU32 isRgb444SupportedOnCurrentMode : 1;
6181 NvU32 isYCbCr444SupportedOnCurrentMode : 1;
6182 NvU32 isYCbCr422SupportedOnCurrentMode : 1;
6183 NvU32 isYCbCr420SupportedOnCurrentMode : 1;
6184 NvU32 is6BPCSupportedOnCurrentMode : 1; // if 6 bpc is supported On Current Mode
6185 NvU32 is8BPCSupportedOnCurrentMode : 1; // if 8 bpc is supported On Current Mode
6186 NvU32 is10BPCSupportedOnCurrentMode : 1; // if 10 bpc is supported On Current Mode
6187 NvU32 is12BPCSupportedOnCurrentMode : 1; // if 12 bpc is supported On Current Mode
6188 NvU32 is16BPCSupportedOnCurrentMode : 1; // if 16 bpc is supported On Current Mode
6189 NvU32 isMonxvYCC601Capable : 1; // if xvYCC 601 extended colorimetry is supported
6190 NvU32 isMonxvYCC709Capable : 1; // if xvYCC 709 extended colorimetry is supported
6191 NvU32 isMonsYCC601Capable : 1; // if sYCC601 extended colorimetry is supported
6192 NvU32 isMonAdobeYCC601Capable : 1; // if AdobeYCC601 extended colorimetry is supported
6193 NvU32 isMonAdobeRGBCapable : 1; // if AdobeRGB extended colorimetry is supported
6194 NvU32 isMonBT2020RGBCapable : 1; // if BT2020 RGB extended colorimetry is supported
6195 NvU32 isMonBT2020YCCCapable : 1; // if BT2020 Y'CbCr extended colorimetry is supported
6196 NvU32 isMonBT2020cYCCCapable : 1; // if BT2020 cYCbCr (constant luminance) extended colorimetry is supported
6197
6198 NvU32 reserved : 4;
6199 } NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_V1;
6200
6201 typedef NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_V1 NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO;
6202
6204#define NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO,1)
6205#define NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO,2)
6206#define NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_VER NV_DISPLAY_PORT_INFO_VER2
6207

6833 } infoframe;

6943 NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY_USER = 0,
6944 NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY_BEST_QUALITY = 1,
6945 NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY_DEFAULT = NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY_BEST_QUALITY,
6946 NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY_UNKNOWN = 0xFF,
6947} NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY;
6948
6949typedef enum _NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH
6950{
6951 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_DEFAULT = 0x0, // set if the current setting should be kept
6952 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_8BPC = 0x1, //8 bit int per color component (8 bit int alpha)
6953 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_10BPC = 0x2, //10 bit int per color component (2 bit int alpha)
6954 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_16BPC_FLOAT = 0x3, //16 bit float per color component (16 bit float alpha)
6955 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_16BPC_FLOAT_WCG = 0x4, //16 bit float per color component (16 bit float alpha) wide color gamut
6956 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_16BPC_FLOAT_HDR = 0x5, //16 bit float per color component (16 bit float alpha) HDR
6957 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_MAX_VALUE = NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH_16BPC_FLOAT_HDR, // must be set to highest enum value
6958} NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH;
6959
6960typedef struct _NV_COLOR_DATA_V1
6961{
6962 NvU32 version;
6963 NvU16 size;
6964 NvU8 cmd;
6965 struct
6966 {
6967 NvU8 colorFormat;
6968 NvU8 colorimetry;
6969 } data;
6970} NV_COLOR_DATA_V1;
6971
6972typedef struct _NV_COLOR_DATA_V2
6973{
6974 NvU32 version;
6975 NvU16 size;
6976 NvU8 cmd;
6977 struct
6978 {
6979 NvU8 colorFormat;
6980 NvU8 colorimetry;
6981 NvU8 dynamicRange;
6982 } data;
6983} NV_COLOR_DATA_V2;
6984

6986{

6991 {
6992 NvU8 colorFormat;

6995 NV_BPC bpc;
6996 } data;
6997} NV_COLOR_DATA_V3;
6998

7000{

7005 {

7011 } data;
7012} NV_COLOR_DATA_V4;
7013

7015{
7016 NvU32 version;

7018 NvU8 cmd;
7019 struct
7020 {
7021 NvU8 colorFormat;
7022 NvU8 colorimetry;
7023 NvU8 dynamicRange;
7024 NV_BPC bpc;
7025 NV_COLOR_SELECTION_POLICY colorSelectionPolicy;
7026 NV_DESKTOP_COLOR_DEPTH depth;
7027 } data;
7028} NV_COLOR_DATA_V5;
7029
7030typedef NV_COLOR_DATA_V5 NV_COLOR_DATA;
7031
7032#define NV_COLOR_DATA_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_COLOR_DATA_V1, 1)
7033#define NV_COLOR_DATA_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_COLOR_DATA_V2, 2)
7034#define NV_COLOR_DATA_VER3 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_COLOR_DATA_V3, 3)

7037#define NV_COLOR_DATA_VER NV_COLOR_DATA_VER5

7055 NvU32 isEdrSupported :1;
7056 NvU32 driverExpandDefaultHdrParameters :1;
7058 NvU32 isTraditionalSdrGammaSupported :1;
7059 NvU32 reserved :27;

7064 {
7065 NvU16 displayPrimary_x0;
7066 NvU16 displayPrimary_y0;
7067
7068 NvU16 displayPrimary_x1;
7069 NvU16 displayPrimary_y1;
7070
7071 NvU16 displayPrimary_x2;
7072 NvU16 displayPrimary_y2;

7075 NvU16 displayWhitePoint_y;

7093 NvU32 isDolbyVisionSupported :1;
7094 NvU32 reserved :26;

7096 NV_STATIC_METADATA_DESCRIPTOR_ID static_metadata_descriptor_id;

7099 {
7100 NvU16 displayPrimary_x0;
7101 NvU16 displayPrimary_y0;

7104 NvU16 displayPrimary_y1;

7107 NvU16 displayPrimary_y2;

7116
7117 struct
7118 {
7119 NvU32 VSVDB_version : 3;
7120 NvU32 dm_version : 8;
7121 NvU32 supports_2160p60hz : 1;
7122 NvU32 supports_YUV422_12bit : 1;
7123 NvU32 supports_global_dimming : 1;
7124 NvU32 colorimetry : 1;
7125 NvU32 supports_backlight_control : 2;
7126 NvU32 backlt_min_luma : 2;
7127 NvU32 interface_supported_by_sink : 2;
7128 NvU32 supports_10b_12b_444 : 2;
7129 NvU32 reserved : 9;

7132 NvU16 target_max_luminance;

7134 NvU16 cc_red_y;

7141 }dv_static_metadata;
7142
7143} NV_HDR_CAPABILITIES_V2;

7176 NV_HDR_CMD_SET = 1

7179typedef enum
7180{
7181 // Official production-ready HDR modes
7182 NV_HDR_MODE_OFF = 0,
7183 NV_HDR_MODE_UHDA = 2,
7184
7185 // Experimental
7186 NV_HDR_MODE_UHDA_PASSTHROUGH = 5,
7187 NV_HDR_MODE_DOLBY_VISION = 7,
7188
7189 // Unsupported/obsolete HDR modes
7190 NV_HDR_MODE_EDR = 3,
7191 NV_HDR_MODE_SDR = 4,
7192 NV_HDR_MODE_UHDA_NB = 6,
7193 NV_HDR_MODE_UHDBD = 2
7194
7195} NV_HDR_MODE;

7296{

7298 NvU32 reserved0 : 12;
7299 union

7306 NvU32 nvPsfId : 8;
7308 };
7309 NvU32 scaling : 8;

7374
7376typedef enum
7377{
7378 // hdmi related caps
7379 NV_MONITOR_CAPS_TYPE_HDMI_VSDB = 0x1000,
7380 NV_MONITOR_CAPS_TYPE_HDMI_VCDB = 0x1001,
7381} NV_MONITOR_CAPS_TYPE;
7382
7383
7384
7385typedef struct _NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VCDB
7386{
7387 NvU8 quantizationRangeYcc : 1;
7388 NvU8 quantizationRangeRgb : 1;
7389 NvU8 scanInfoPreferredVideoFormat : 2;
7390 NvU8 scanInfoITVideoFormats : 2;
7391 NvU8 scanInfoCEVideoFormats : 2;
7392} NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VCDB;
7393
7394
7396typedef struct _NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VSDB
7397{
7398 // byte 1
7399 NvU8 sourcePhysicalAddressB : 4;
7400 NvU8 sourcePhysicalAddressA : 4;
7401 // byte 2
7402 NvU8 sourcePhysicalAddressD : 4;
7403 NvU8 sourcePhysicalAddressC : 4;
7404 // byte 3
7405 NvU8 supportDualDviOperation : 1;
7406 NvU8 reserved6 : 2;
7407 NvU8 supportDeepColorYCbCr444 : 1;
7408 NvU8 supportDeepColor30bits : 1;
7409 NvU8 supportDeepColor36bits : 1;
7410 NvU8 supportDeepColor48bits : 1;
7411 NvU8 supportAI : 1;
7412 // byte 4
7413 NvU8 maxTmdsClock;
7414 // byte 5
7415 NvU8 cnc0SupportGraphicsTextContent : 1;
7416 NvU8 cnc1SupportPhotoContent : 1;
7417 NvU8 cnc2SupportCinemaContent : 1;
7418 NvU8 cnc3SupportGameContent : 1;
7419 NvU8 reserved8 : 1;
7420 NvU8 hasVicEntries : 1;
7421 NvU8 hasInterlacedLatencyField : 1;
7422 NvU8 hasLatencyField : 1;
7423 // byte 6
7424 NvU8 videoLatency;
7425 // byte 7
7426 NvU8 audioLatency;
7427 // byte 8
7428 NvU8 interlacedVideoLatency;
7429 // byte 9
7430 NvU8 interlacedAudioLatency;
7431 // byte 10
7432 NvU8 reserved13 : 7;
7433 NvU8 has3dEntries : 1;
7434 // byte 11
7435 NvU8 hdmi3dLength : 5;
7436 NvU8 hdmiVicLength : 3;
7437 // Remaining bytes
7438 NvU8 hdmi_vic[7];
7439 NvU8 hdmi_3d[31];
7440} NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VSDB;
7441
7442typedef struct _NV_MONITOR_CAPS_GENERIC
7443{
7444 NvU8 supportVRR : 1;
7445 NvU8 supportULMB : 1;
7446 NvU8 isTrueGsync : 1;
7447 NvU8 isRLACapable : 1;
7448 NvU8 reserved : 4;
7449} NV_MONITOR_CAPS_GENERIC;
7450
7452typedef struct _NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES_V1
7453{
7454 NvU32 version;
7455 NvU16 size;
7456 NvU32 infoType;
7457 NvU32 connectorType;
7458 NvU8 bIsValidInfo : 1;
7459 union {
7460 NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VSDB vsdb;
7461 NV_MONITOR_CAPS_VCDB vcdb;
7462 NV_MONITOR_CAPS_GENERIC caps;
7463 } data;
7464} NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES_V1;
7465
7466typedef NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES_V1 NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES;
7467
7469#define NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MONITOR_CAPABILITIES_V1,1)

7955

7957#define NV_GET_VIRTUAL_REFRESH_RATE_DATA_VER NV_GET_VIRTUAL_REFRESH_RATE_DATA_VER1
7958
7959typedef NV_GET_VIRTUAL_REFRESH_RATE_DATA_V1 NV_GET_VIRTUAL_REFRESH_RATE_DATA;
7960
7962//

8199
8200
8201
8203//
8204// MOSAIC allows a multi display target output scanout on a single source.
8205//
8206// SAMPLE of MOSAIC 1x4 topo with 8 pixel horizontal overlap
8207//
8208//+-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------+
8209//| || || || |
8210//| || || || |
8211//| || || || |
8212//| DVI1 || DVI2 || DVI3 || DVI4 |
8213//| || || || |
8214//| || || || |
8215//| || || || |
8216//| || || || |
8217//+-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------+
8218
8219
8222
8223#define NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_ROWS 8
8224#define NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_COLUMNS 8
8225//
8226// These bits are used to describe the validity of a topo.
8227//
8228#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_VALIDITY_VALID 0x00000000
8229#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_VALIDITY_MISSING_GPU 0x00000001
8231#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_VALIDITY_MISSING_DISPLAY 0x00000002
8233#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_VALIDITY_MIXED_DISPLAY_TYPES 0x00000004
8236
8237
8238//
8240typedef struct
8241{
8242 NvU32 version;
8243 NvLogicalGpuHandle hLogicalGPU;
8244 NvU32 validityMask;
8246 NvU32 rowCount;
8247 NvU32 colCount;
8248
8249 struct
8250 {
8251 NvPhysicalGpuHandle hPhysicalGPU;
8252 NvU32 displayOutputId;
8253 NvS32 overlapX;
8254 NvS32 overlapY;
8255
8256 } gpuLayout[NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_ROWS][NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_COLUMNS];
8257
8258} NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_DETAILS;
8259
8261#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_TOPO_DETAILS_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_DETAILS,1)
8262
8263
8264//
8268typedef enum
8269{
8270 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_ALL,
8271 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_BASIC,
8272 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8273 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_SCALED_CLONE,
8274 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_PASSIVE_STEREO_SCALED_CLONE,
8275 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE_MAX,
8276} NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_TYPE;
8277
8278
8279//
8289typedef enum
8290{
8291 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_NONE,
8292
8293 // 'BASIC' topos start here
8294 //
8295 // The result of using one of these Mosaic topos is that multiple monitors
8296 // will combine to create a single desktop.
8297 //
8298 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BEGIN_BASIC,
8299 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x2_BASIC = NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BEGIN_BASIC,
8300 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x1_BASIC,
8301 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x3_BASIC,
8302 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_3x1_BASIC,
8303 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x4_BASIC,
8304 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_4x1_BASIC,
8305 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x2_BASIC,
8306 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x3_BASIC,
8307 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x4_BASIC,
8308 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_3x2_BASIC,
8309 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_4x2_BASIC,
8310 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x5_BASIC,
8311 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x6_BASIC,
8312 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_7x1_BASIC,
8313
8314 // Add padding for 10 more entries. 6 will be enough room to specify every
8315 // possible topology with 8 or fewer displays, so this gives us a little
8316 // extra should we need it.
8317 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_END_BASIC = NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_7x1_BASIC + 9,
8318
8319 // 'PASSIVE_STEREO' topos start here
8320 //
8321 // The result of using one of these Mosaic topos is that multiple monitors
8322 // will combine to create a single PASSIVE STEREO desktop. What this means is
8323 // that there will be two topos that combine to create the overall desktop.
8324 // One topo will be used for the left eye, and the other topo (of the
8325 // same rows x cols), will be used for the right eye. The difference between
8326 // the two topos is that different GPUs and displays will be used.
8327 //
8328 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BEGIN_PASSIVE_STEREO, // value shadowed in nvEscDef.h
8329 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x2_PASSIVE_STEREO = NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BEGIN_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8330 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x1_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8331 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x3_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8332 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_3x1_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8333 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_1x4_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8334 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_4x1_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8335 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x2_PASSIVE_STEREO,
8336 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_END_PASSIVE_STEREO = NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_2x2_PASSIVE_STEREO + 4,
8337
8338
8339 //
8340 // Total number of topos. Always leave this at the end of the enumeration.
8341 //
8342 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_MAX
8343
8344} NV_MOSAIC_TOPO;
8345
8346
8347//
8354typedef struct
8355{
8356 NvU32 version;
8357 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO topo;
8358 NvU32 enabled;
8359 NvU32 isPossible;
8360
8361} NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF;
8362
8364#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF,1)
8365
8366
8367//

8370{

8372 NvU32 width;
8373 NvU32 height;
8374 NvU32 bpp;
8375 NvU32 freq;
8376} NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V1;
8377
8378typedef struct NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V2
8379{
8380 NvU32 version;
8381 NvU32 width;
8382 NvU32 height;
8383 NvU32 bpp;
8384 NvU32 freq;
8385 NvU32 rrx1k;
8386} NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V2;
8387
8388typedef NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V2 NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING;
8389
8391#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V1,1)
8392#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V2,2)
8393#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_VER NVAPI_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_VER2
8394
8395
8396//
8397// Set a reasonable max number of display settings to support
8398// so arrays are bound.
8399//
8400#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTINGS_MAX 40
8402
8403
8404//
8407typedef struct _NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V1

8410 NvU32 topoBriefsCount;
8411 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF topoBriefs[NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_MAX];
8412 NvU32 displaySettingsCount;
8413 NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V1 displaySettings[NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTINGS_MAX];
8414
8415} NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V1;
8416
8417typedef struct _NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V2
8418{

8420 NvU32 topoBriefsCount;
8421 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF topoBriefs[NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_MAX];
8422 NvU32 displaySettingsCount;
8423 NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING_V2 displaySettings[NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTINGS_MAX];
8424
8425} NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V2;
8426
8427typedef NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V2 NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO;
8428
8430#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V1,1)
8431#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_VER2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_V2,2)
8432#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_VER NVAPI_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPO_INFO_VER2
8433

8435//
8436// Indices to use to access the topos array within the mosaic topology
8437#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_IDX_DEFAULT 0
8438
8439#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_IDX_LEFT_EYE 0
8440#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_IDX_RIGHT_EYE 1
8441#define NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_NUM_EYES 2

8474 NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_BRIEF brief;

8477
8478} NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_GROUP;
8479
8481#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_TOPO_GROUP_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_TOPO_GROUP,1)

8763} NV_PIXEL_SHIFT_TYPE;

8831
8832#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_DISPLAY_ON_INVALID_GPU NV_BIT(0)
8833#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_DISPLAY_ON_WRONG_CONNECTOR NV_BIT(1)
8834#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NO_COMMON_TIMINGS NV_BIT(2)
8835#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NO_EDID_AVAILABLE NV_BIT(3)
8836#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_MISMATCHED_OUTPUT_TYPE NV_BIT(4)
8837#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NO_DISPLAY_CONNECTED NV_BIT(5)
8838#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NO_GPU_TOPOLOGY NV_BIT(6)
8839#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NOT_SUPPORTED NV_BIT(7)
8840#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_NO_SLI_BRIDGE NV_BIT(8)
8841#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_ECC_ENABLED NV_BIT(9)
8842#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYCAPS_PROBLEM_GPU_TOPOLOGY_NOT_SUPPORTED NV_BIT(10)
8843

8852#define NV_MOSAIC_SETDISPLAYTOPO_FLAG_CURRENT_GPU_TOPOLOGY NV_BIT(0)
8853
8856#define NV_MOSAIC_SETDISPLAYTOPO_FLAG_NO_DRIVER_RELOAD NV_BIT(1)
8857
8861#define NV_MOSAIC_SETDISPLAYTOPO_FLAG_MAXIMIZE_PERFORMANCE NV_BIT(2)

8864#define NV_MOSAIC_SETDISPLAYTOPO_FLAG_ALLOW_INVALID NV_BIT(3)

8867//
8868// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Mosaic_SetDisplayGrids
8869//
8897NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Mosaic_SetDisplayGrids(__in_ecount(gridCount) NV_MOSAIC_GRID_TOPO *pGridTopologies, __in NvU32 gridCount, __in NvU32 setTopoFlags);
8898
8899
8902#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYTOPO_WARNING_DISPLAY_POSITION NV_BIT(0)
8903
8906#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAYTOPO_WARNING_DRIVER_RELOAD_REQUIRED NV_BIT(1)
8907
8909typedef struct
8910{
8911 NvU32 version;
8912 NvU32 errorFlags;
8913 NvU32 warningFlags;
8914
8915 NvU32 displayCount;
8916 struct
8917 {
8918 NvU32 displayId;
8919 NvU32 errorFlags;
8920 NvU32 warningFlags;
8921
8922 NvU32 supportsRotation : 1;
8923 NvU32 reserved : 31;
8924 } displays[NVAPI_MAX_DISPLAYS];
8925} NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_TOPO_STATUS;
8926
8928#define NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_TOPO_STATUS_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_TOPO_STATUS,1)
8929
8930
8932//
8933// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Mosaic_ValidateDisplayGrids
8934//
8972NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Mosaic_ValidateDisplayGrids(__in NvU32 setTopoFlags,
8973 __in_ecount(gridCount) NV_MOSAIC_GRID_TOPO *pGridTopologies,
8974 __inout_ecount_full(gridCount) NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_TOPO_STATUS *pTopoStatus,
8975 __in NvU32 gridCount);

8978
8980//
8981// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Mosaic_EnumDisplayModes
8982//
9007NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Mosaic_EnumDisplayModes(__in NV_MOSAIC_GRID_TOPO *pGridTopology,
9008 __inout_ecount_part_opt(*pDisplayCount, *pDisplayCount) NV_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_SETTING *pDisplaySettings,
9009 __inout NvU32 *pDisplayCount);
9010
9011
9015//
9016// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_Mosaic_EnumDisplayGrids
9017//
9040NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_Mosaic_EnumDisplayGrids(__inout_ecount_part_opt(*pGridCount, *pGridCount) NV_MOSAIC_GRID_TOPO *pGridTopologies,
9041 __inout NvU32 *pGridCount);
9042
9043
9045//
9046// ###########################################################################
9047// DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS
9048//
9049// Below is the Phase 1 Mosaic stuff, the Phase 2 stuff above is what will remain
9050// once Phase 2 is complete. For a small amount of time, the two will co-exist. As
9051// soon as apps (nvapichk, NvAPITestMosaic, and CPL) are updated to use the Phase 2
9052// entrypoints, the code below will be deleted.
9053//
9054// DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS - DELME_RUSS
9055// ###########################################################################
9056//
9057// Supported topos 1x4, 4x1 and 2x2 to start with.
9058//
9059// Selected scan out targets can be one per GPU or more than one on the same GPU.
9060//
9061// SAMPLE of MOSAIC 1x4 SCAN OUT TOPO with 8 pixel horizontal overlap
9062//
9063//+-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------+
9064//| || || || |
9065//| || || || |
9066//| || || || |
9067//| DVI1 || DVI2 || DVI3 || DVI4 |
9068//| || || || |
9069//| || || || |
9070//| || || || |
9071//| || || || |
9072//+-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------++-------------------------+
9073
9074
9077
9079#define NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_ROWS 8
9080
9082#define NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_COLUMNS 8
9083
9085#define NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_TOPOS 16
9086
9088typedef struct
9089{
9090 NvU32 version;
9091 NvU32 rowCount;
9092 NvU32 colCount;
9093
9094 struct
9095 {
9096 NvPhysicalGpuHandle hPhysicalGPU;
9097 NvU32 displayOutputId;
9098 NvS32 overlapX;
9099 NvS32 overlapY;
9100
9101 } gpuLayout[NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_ROWS][NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_DISPLAY_COLUMNS];
9102
9103} NV_MOSAIC_TOPOLOGY;
9104
9106#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_TOPOLOGY_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_TOPOLOGY,1)
9107
9109typedef struct
9110{
9111 NvU32 version;
9112 NvU32 totalCount;
9113 NV_MOSAIC_TOPOLOGY topos[NVAPI_MAX_MOSAIC_TOPOS];
9114
9115} NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPOLOGIES;
9116
9118#define NVAPI_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPOLOGIES_VER MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_MOSAIC_SUPPORTED_TOPOLOGIES,1)
9119

10922typedef enum _NV_PRESENT_BARRIER_SYNC_MODE
10923{
10924 PRESENT_BARRIER_NOT_JOINED = 0x00000000,
10925 PRESENT_BARRIER_SYNC_CLIENT = 0x00000001,
10928 PRESENT_BARRIER_SYNC_SYSTEM = 0x00000002,
10930 PRESENT_BARRIER_SYNC_CLUSTER = 0x00000003,
10932} NV_PRESENT_BARRIER_SYNC_MODE;

11019
11020enum NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE
11021{
11022 NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE_DISABLED = 0,
11023 NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE_BBOX = 1,
11024 NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE_FULL_VIEWPORT = 2,
11025};

11028
11031#if defined (__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d11_1_h__))
11032
11033typedef struct NvAPI_D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC_EX
11034{
11035 // D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC member variables
11036 D3D11_FILL_MODE FillMode;
11037 D3D11_CULL_MODE CullMode;
11038 BOOL FrontCounterClockwise;
11039 INT DepthBias;
11040 FLOAT DepthBiasClamp;
11041 FLOAT SlopeScaledDepthBias;
11042 BOOL DepthClipEnable;
11043 BOOL ScissorEnable;
11044 BOOL MultisampleEnable;
11045 BOOL AntialiasedLineEnable;
11046
11047 // NvAPI_D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC_EX specific member variables
11048 NvU32 ForcedSampleCount; //<! Added DX 11.1, part of _DESC1 version of this struct.
11049 bool ProgrammableSamplePositionsEnable; //<! enable Programmable Samples feature
11050 bool InterleavedSamplingEnable; //<! when jitter is enabled, an app need to fill the whole arrays below, otherwise only as much entries as samples
11051 NvU8 SampleCount; //<! number of samples. In TIR N->1 it needs to match N, in non-TIR it needs to match RT sample count. Ignored if ForcePerSampleInterlock is set
11052 NvU8 SamplePositionsX[16]; //<! x positions in API sample order
11053 NvU8 SamplePositionsY[16]; //<! y positions in API sample order
11054 bool ConservativeRasterEnable; //<! rasterize all pixels a primitive touches in any way instead of just those with the centroid covered.
11055 NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE QuadFillMode; //<! Fill a triangle outside its bounds as a screen-aligned quad, matching the tri's bounding-box or filling the full viewport.
11056 bool PostZCoverageEnable; //<! Enable pixel-shader input SV_COVERAGE to account for z-test in early-z mode.
11057 bool CoverageToColorEnable; //<! Enable output of coverage to a color render-target.
11058 NvU8 CoverageToColorRTIndex; //<! Index of RT for coverage-to-color.
11059 bool TargetIndepentRasterWithDepth; //<! TargetIndepentRasterWithDepth = TRUE enables rasterezation mode where sample count of both raster and depth-stencil buffer are equal and do not match RT sample count.
11060 NvU8 reserved[63]; //<! reserved for expansion, set to zero.
11061} NvAPI_D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC_EX;
11062
11064//
11065// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_D3D11_CreateRasterizerState
11066//
11085NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_D3D11_CreateRasterizerState(__in ID3D11Device *pDevice,
11086 __in const NvAPI_D3D11_RASTERIZER_DESC_EX *pRasterizerDesc,
11087 __out ID3D11RasterizerState **ppRasterizerState);
11088
11089#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__)

11123 NVAPI_ANSEL_FEATURE_STATE_DISABLE = 2

11130 NVAPI_ANSEL_HOTKEY_MODIFIER_SHIFT = 2,

11146} NVAPI_ANSEL_CONFIGURATION_STRUCT_V1;

11537//
11538// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_D3D11_CopyTileMappings
11539//
11541//
11554
11564NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_D3D11_CopyTileMappings(
11565 __in ID3D11DeviceContext *pDeviceContext,
11566 __in ID3D11Resource *pDestTiledResource,
11567 __in const D3D11_TILED_RESOURCE_COORDINATE *pDestRegionStartCoordinate,
11568 __in ID3D11Resource *pSourceTiledResource,
11569 __in const D3D11_TILED_RESOURCE_COORDINATE *pSourceRegionStartCoordinate,
11570 __in const D3D11_TILE_REGION_SIZE *pTileRegionSize,
11571 __in UINT Flags);
11572
11573#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_2_h__)
11574
11577
11578#if defined (__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_2_h__)
11579

11582// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_D3D11_TiledResourceBarrier
11583//
11585//
11594
11604NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_D3D11_TiledResourceBarrier(
11605 __in ID3D11DeviceContext *pDeviceContext,
11606 __in ID3D11Resource *pTiledResourceAccessBeforeBarrier,
11607 __in ID3D11Resource *pTiledResourceAccessAfterBarrier);
11608
11609#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_2_h__)

11618// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_D3D11_AliasMSAATexture2DAsNonMSAA
11619//

11642 __in ID3D11Texture2D *pInputTex,
11643 __out ID3D11Texture2D **ppOutTex);

11645#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__)
11646
11647#if defined (__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
11648typedef UINT NvAPI_D3D11_SWIZZLE_MODE;
11649
11650typedef enum _NV_SWIZZLE_MODE
11651{
11652 NV_SWIZZLE_POS_X = 0,
11653 NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_X = 1,
11654 NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Y = 2,
11655 NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_Y = 3,
11656 NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Z = 4,
11657 NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_Z = 5,
11658 NV_SWIZZLE_POS_W = 6,
11659 NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_W = 7
11660}NV_SWIZZLE_MODE;
11661
11662typedef enum _NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET
11663{
11664 NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_X = 0,
11665 NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Y = 4,
11666 NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Z = 8,
11667 NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_W = 12
11668}NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET;
11669
11670#endif //defined (__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
11671
11674
11675#if defined (__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
11676#define NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX_LIMIT 32
11677
11678typedef enum NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_TYPE
11679{
11680 NV_NONE_SEMANTIC = 0,
11681 NV_X_RIGHT_SEMANTIC = 1,
11682 NV_VIEWPORT_MASK_SEMANTIC = 2,
11683 NV_XYZW_RIGHT_SEMANTIC = 3,
11684 NV_VIEWPORT_MASK_2_SEMANTIC = 4,
11685
11686 NV_POSITION_SEMANTIC = 5,
11687 NV_CLIP_DISTANCE_0_SEMANTIC = 6, // MultiView can accept upto two vec4 values. So the application should not use
11688 NV_CLIP_DISTANCE_1_SEMANTIC = 7, // more than 2 of the below Clip / Cull semantics in a single shader.
11689 NV_CULL_DISTANCE_0_SEMANTIC = 8,
11690 NV_CULL_DISTANCE_1_SEMANTIC = 9,
11691 NV_GENERIC_ATTRIBUTE_SEMANTIC = 10,
11692
11693 NV_PACKED_EYE_INDEX_SEMANTIC = 17,
11694 NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX = NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX_LIMIT,
11695} NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_TYPE;
11696
11697typedef struct _NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC
11698{
11699 UINT version; // NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_VERSION
11700
11701 NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_TYPE NVCustomSemanticType; // type of custom semantic (NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_TYPE)
11702 NvAPI_LongString NVCustomSemanticNameString; // name of custom semantic e.g. "NV_X_RIGHT", "NV_VIEWPORT_MASK"
11703 BOOL RegisterSpecified; // (optional) set to TRUE to explicitly provide register number and mask as below
11704 NvU32 RegisterNum; // (optional) output register which has the custom semantic.
11705 NvU32 RegisterMask; // (optional) output register component mask which has the custom semantic (X:1, Y:2, Z:4)
11706 NvU32 Reserved; // reserved
11707} NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC;
11708
11709#define NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_VERSION MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC, 1)
11710
11711#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
11712
11713#if defined (__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))

11718

11724 BOOL UseCoordinateSwizzle;
11725 NvAPI_D3D11_SWIZZLE_MODE *pCoordinateSwizzling;
11726
11727 NvU32 NumCustomSemantics; // Number of custom semantics elements (upto NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX) provided in array pointer pCustomSemantics
11728 NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC *pCustomSemantics; // pointer to array of NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC
11729 BOOL ConvertToFastGS; // reserved
11730 BOOL UseSpecificShaderExt; // TRUE if creating minimal specific shaders with nvapi shader extensions
11731} NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_GEOMETRY_SHADER_EX_V5;

12041
12042typedef struct NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_PIXEL_SHADER_EX_V2
12043{
12044 UINT version; // Always use NVAPI_D3D11_CREATEPIXELSHADEREX_VERSION
12045
12046 NvU32 NumCustomSemantics; // Number of custom semantics elements (upto NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX) provided in array pointer pCustomSemantics
12047 NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC *pCustomSemantics; // pointer to array of NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC
12048 NvU32 bEnableSuperSamplingPredicationForVRS : 1; // This enables sampling within a pixel for SuperSampling mode of Variable Rate Shading for relevant attributes tagged with "sample" modifier
12049 NvU32 bEnableSuperSamplingPredicationForVRSAllAttributes : 1; // This enables sampling within a pixel for SuperSampling mode of Variable Rate Shading for all relevant attributes
12050 NvU32 reserved : 30; // Reserved for further use
12051} NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_PIXEL_SHADER_EX_V2;

12090
12091NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_D3D11_CreatePixelShaderEx_2(__in ID3D11Device *pDevice, __in const void *pShaderBytecode,
12092 __in SIZE_T BytecodeLength, __in_opt ID3D11ClassLinkage *pClassLinkage,

12097
12100
12101#if defined (__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
12102
12103typedef enum _NV_FASTGS_FLAGS
12104{
12105 NV_FASTGS_USE_VIEWPORT_MASK = 0x01, // Causes SV_ViewportArrayIndex value to be interpreted as a bitmask of viewports to broadcast to.
12106 NV_FASTGS_OFFSET_RT_INDEX_BY_VP_INDEX = 0x02, // Causes SV_RenderTargetArrayIndex value to be offset by the viewport index when broadcasting.
12107 NV_FASTGS_STRICT_API_ORDER = 0x04, // Causes broadcast primitives to be rendered strictly in API order (slow).
12108 // By default, primitives may be batched per viewport to improve performance.
12109} NV_FASTGS_FLAGS;
12110
12111#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && (defined(__d3d11_h__) || defined(__d3d12_h__)) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
12112
12113#if defined (__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
12114
12115struct NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1
12116{
12117 NvU32 version; // ALWAYS == NVAPI_D3D11_CREATEFASTGSEXPLICIT_VER
12118 NvU32 flags; // A combination of flags from NV_FASTGS_FLAGS
12119 NvAPI_D3D11_SWIZZLE_MODE *pCoordinateSwizzling; // [optional] Array of 16 coordinate swizzle modes, one per viewport. NULL if not used.
12120 // The output x, y, z, and w coordinates of all vertices can be set to any of the coordinates or their
12121 // negated versions i.e. {x, y, z, w, -x, -y, -z, -w}. Coordinates are swizzled before any viewport
12122 // operation occurs i.e. before frustum clipping, scaling, and viewport clipping. And after
12123 // last of vertex/tesselation/geometry shader stage, stream-out and viewport broadcast expansion (see NV_FASTGS_USE_VIEWPORT_MASK)
12124 // pCoordinateSwizzling[i] sets the swizzle-mode of each component for viewport i.
12125 // See NV_SWIZZLE_MODE for values of allowed swizzle modes.
12126 // See NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET for bit offset from where NV_SWIZZLE_MODE to be set for each component.
12127 // For example :
12128 // 1. To set swizzle for viewport 0 such that - w and z are unchanged and values of x and y are swapped :
12129 // pCoordinateSwizzling[0] = (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_W << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_W) |
12130 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Z << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Z) |
12131 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_X << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Y) |
12132 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Y << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_X);
12133 // 2. To set swizzle for viewport 0 such that - w, z and y are unchanged and value of x is negated :
12134 // pCoordinateSwizzling[0] = (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_W << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_W) |
12135 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Z << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Z) |
12136 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Y << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Y) |
12137 // (NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_X << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_X);
12138 // Need to set some valid combination of swizzle-modes for all viewports, irrespective of whether that viewport is set.
12139 // Invalid swizzle-mode for any viewport (even if that viewport is not set) may result in removal of device.
12140};
12141
12142#define NVAPI_D3D11_CREATEFASTGSEXPLICIT_VER1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1, 1)
12143#define NVAPI_D3D11_CREATEFASTGSEXPLICIT_VER NVAPI_D3D11_CREATEFASTGSEXPLICIT_VER1
12144
12145typedef NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1 NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC;
12146
12148//
12149// FUNCTION NAME: NvAPI_D3D11_CreateFastGeometryShaderExplicit
12150//
12183//
12185
12186NVAPI_INTERFACE NvAPI_D3D11_CreateFastGeometryShaderExplicit(__in ID3D11Device *pDevice, __in const void *pShaderBytecode,
12187 __in SIZE_T BytecodeLength, __in_opt ID3D11ClassLinkage *pClassLinkage,
12188 __in const NvAPI_D3D11_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC *pCreateFastGSArgs,
12189 __out ID3D11GeometryShader **ppGeometryShader);
12190
12191#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))
12192
12195
12196#if defined (__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__) && (!defined(CINTERFACE) )

12232 __in SIZE_T BytecodeLength, __in_opt ID3D11ClassLinkage *pClassLinkage,
12233 __out ID3D11GeometryShader **ppGeometryShader);

12235#endif //defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d11_h__) && (!defined(CINTERFACE))

12264

12268#if defined (__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d12_h__)
12269
12273typedef enum _NV_PSO_EXTENSION
12274{
12275 NV_PSO_RASTER_EXTENSION = 0,
12276 NV_PSO_REQUEST_FASTGS_EXTENSION = 1,
12277 NV_PSO_GEOMETRY_SHADER_EXTENSION = 2,
12278 NV_PSO_ENABLE_DEPTH_BOUND_TEST_EXTENSION = 3,
12279 NV_PSO_EXPLICIT_FASTGS_EXTENSION = 4,
12280 NV_PSO_SET_SHADER_EXTNENSION_SLOT_AND_SPACE = 5,
12281 NV_PSO_SET_SHADER_EXTENSION_SLOT_AND_SPACE = 5,
12282 NV_PSO_VERTEX_SHADER_EXTENSION = 6,
12283 NV_PSO_DOMAIN_SHADER_EXTENSION = 7,
12284 NV_PSO_HULL_SHADER_EXTENSION = 9,
12285}NV_PSO_EXTENSION;
12286
12287struct NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_V1
12288{
12289 NvU32 baseVersion; //<! Always use NV_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER
12290 NV_PSO_EXTENSION psoExtension;
12291};
12292
12293#define NV_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_V1, 1)
12294#define NV_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER NV_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_1
12295
12296typedef NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_V1 NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC;
12297
12298
12299struct NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_RASTERIZER_STATE_DESC_V1 : public NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC
12300{
12301 NvU32 version; //<! Always use NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER
12302 // These are additional parameters on the top of D3D12_RASTERIZER_DESC
12303 bool ProgrammableSamplePositionsEnable; //<! enable Programmable Samples feature
12304 bool InterleavedSamplingEnable; //<! when jitter is enabled, an app need to fill the whole arrays below, otherwise only as much entries as samples
12305 NvU8 SampleCount; //<! number of samples. In TIR N->1 it needs to match N, in non-TIR it needs to match RT sample count. Ignored if ForcePerSampleInterlock is set
12306 NvU8 SamplePositionsX[16]; //<! x positions in API sample order
12307 NvU8 SamplePositionsY[16]; //<! y positions in API sample order
12308 NVAPI_QUAD_FILLMODE QuadFillMode; //<! Fill a triangle outside its bounds as a screen-aligned quad, matching the tri's bounding-box or filling the full viewport.
12309 bool PostZCoverageEnable; //<! Enable pixel-shader input SV_COVERAGE to account for z-test in early-z mode.
12310 bool CoverageToColorEnable; //<! Enable output of coverage to a color render-target.
12311 NvU8 CoverageToColorRTIndex; //<! Index of RT for coverage-to-color.
12312
12313 //Added with NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_2
12314 bool TargetIndepentRasterWithDepth; //<! TargetIndepentRasterWithDepth = TRUE enables rasterezation mode where sample count of both raster and depth-stencil buffer are equal and do not match RT sample count.
12315 NvU8 ForcedSampleCount; //<! Must be set when TargetIndepentRasterWithDepth is true - refers to SampleDesc.Count for the DSV
12316
12317 //Reserved
12318 NvU8 reserved[62]; //<! reserved for expansion, set to zero.
12319};
12320
12321#define NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_RASTERIZER_STATE_DESC_V1, 1)
12322#define NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_2 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_RASTERIZER_STATE_DESC_V1, 2)
12323#define NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER NV_RASTERIZER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_2
12324
12325typedef NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_RASTERIZER_STATE_DESC_V1 NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_RASTERIZER_STATE_DESC;
12326
12327struct NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1 : public NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC
12328{
12329 NvU32 version; // ALWAYS == NV_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_PSO_EXTENSION_VER
12330 NvU32 flags; // A combination of flags from NV_FASTGS_FLAGS
12331 NvAPI_D3D11_SWIZZLE_MODE *pCoordinateSwizzling; // [optional] Array of 16 coordinate swizzle modes, one per viewport. NULL if not used.
12332 // The output x, y, z, and w coordinates of all vertices can be set to any of the coordinates or their
12333 // negated versions i.e. {x, y, z, w, -x, -y, -z, -w}. Coordinates are swizzled before any viewport
12334 // operation occurs i.e. before frustum clipping, scaling, and viewport clipping. And after
12335 // last of vertex/tesselation/geometry shader stage, stream-out and viewport broadcast expansion (see NV_FASTGS_USE_VIEWPORT_MASK)
12336 // pCoordinateSwizzling[i] sets the swizzle-mode of each component for viewport i.
12337 // See NV_SWIZZLE_MODE for values of allowed swizzle modes.
12338 // See NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET for bit offset from where NV_SWIZZLE_MODE to be set for each component.
12339 // For example :
12340 // 1. To set swizzle for viewport 0 such that - w and z are unchanged and values of x and y are swapped :
12341 // pCoordinateSwizzling[0] = (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_W << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_W) |
12342 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Z << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Z) |
12343 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_X << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Y) |
12344 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Y << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_X);
12345 // 2. To set swizzle for viewport 0 such that - w, z and y are unchanged and value of x is negated :
12346 // pCoordinateSwizzling[0] = (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_W << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_W) |
12347 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Z << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Z) |
12348 // (NV_SWIZZLE_POS_Y << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_Y) |
12349 // (NV_SWIZZLE_NEG_X << NV_SWIZZLE_OFFSET_X);
12350 // Need to set some valid combination of swizzle-modes for all viewports, irrespective of whether that viewport is set.
12351 // Invalid swizzle-mode for any viewport (even if that viewport is not set) may result in removal of device.
12352};
12353
12354#define NV_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_PSO_EXTENSION_VER_1 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1, 1)
12355#define NV_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_PSO_EXTENSION_VER NV_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_PSO_EXTENSION_VER_1
12356
12357typedef NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC_V1 NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_CREATE_FASTGS_EXPLICIT_DESC;
12358
12359
12360struct NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_REQUEST_FAST_GEOMETRY_SHADER_DESC_V1 : public NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC
12361{
12362 NvU32 version; //<! Always use NV_FAST_GEOMETRY_SHADER_PSO_EXTENSION_VER
12363};

12370
12371struct NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_GEOMETRY_SHADER_DESC_V5 : public NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC
12372{
12373 NvU32 version; //<! Always use NV_GEOMETRY_SHADER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER
12374
12375 BOOL UseViewportMask; // Set to FALSE for custom semantic shaders. Tell the driver to create a shader that outputs the viewport mask in lieu of the viewport index. See above description.
12376 BOOL OffsetRtIndexByVpIndex; // Set to FALSE for custom semantic shaders. The Rendertarget index is offset by the viewport index
12377 BOOL ForceFastGS; // If TRUE, GS must be written with maxvertexcount(1) and must pass-through input vertex 0 to the output without modification
12378 BOOL DontUseViewportOrder; // Default FALSE for Primitives batched per viewport to improve performance. Set TRUE for API order (slow).
12379 BOOL UseAttributeSkipMask; // Reserved
12380 BOOL UseCoordinateSwizzle; // Reserved
12381 NvAPI_D3D11_SWIZZLE_MODE *pCoordinateSwizzling; // Reserved
12382
12383 NvU32 NumCustomSemantics; // Number of custom semantics elements (upto NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC_MAX) provided in array pointer pCustomSemantics
12384 NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC *pCustomSemantics; // pointer to array of NV_CUSTOM_SEMANTIC
12385
12386 BOOL ConvertToFastGS; // Tell the driver to attempt to create a fast geometry shader
12387
12388 BOOL UseSpecificShaderExt; // TRUE if creating minimal specific shaders with nvapi shader extensions
12389};
12390
12391#define NV_GEOMETRY_SHADER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_5 MAKE_NVAPI_VERSION(NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_GEOMETRY_SHADER_DESC_V5, 5)
12392#define NV_GEOMETRY_SHADER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER NV_GEOMETRY_SHADER_PSO_EXTENSION_DESC_VER_5
12393
12394typedef NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_GEOMETRY_SHADER_DESC_V5 NVAPI_D3D12_PSO_GEOMETRY_SHADER_DESC;

12494
12497typedef enum _NV_COMPUTE_SHADER_DERIVATIVES
12498{
12499 NV_COMPUTE_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_NONE = 0, // No support for compute derivatives
12500
12501 NV_COMPUTE_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_GROUP_LINEAR = 1, // Compute derivatives supported. Quads are defined as groups of four threads with linear thread IDs of the form 4N..4N + 3
12502
12503 NV_COMPUTE_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_GROUP_QUADS = 2, // Compute derivatives supported. Quads are defined as group of 2x2 thread IDs in a 2D (or 3D) CTA. In this mode
12504 // the app must ensure that width and height of the CTA dimension are both multiples of 2
12505} NV_COMPUTE_SHADER_DERIVATIVES;

12532 NvU32 numExtensions,

12534 __out ID3D12PipelineState **ppPSO);
12535

12938#if defined(__cplusplus) && defined(__d3d12_h__)
12941// Experimental API for internal use. DO NOT USE!
12942
12943typedef struct
12944{
